lines.text: Strangest feeling in the back of my neck that somebody might throw a knife at me any minute.
Turn your back to the wall and there won't be room for anybody to throw anything.
I feel like I've had my back to the wall ever since I set foot in this country.
How long do you like your spaghetti cooked?
Oh... about... about ten inches. Have you lived here all your life?
Not yet.
The night's a kitten. Let's give her some milk.
What's this?
Sherry - nice and dry and Spanish.
I like mine wet.
The only other thing you can have is water.
Oh, no, no, no. Never touch it - unhygenic.
Drink up and don't talk.
I gotta go.
Why?
Ask the clock.

[narrating as he enters a dingy club]
This didn't look like a safe place to take your mother. In fact, it looked like a place you leave horizontally or not at all.

[apologizing after being bumped into the musicians]
Can I, uh, can I get you a drink to make it up?
I wouldn't use force to stop you.
[as Brad is walking away]
Ask the man for the bottle!
[he does a double take]

[sarcastically, to the bartender]
If I asked her if she wanted a smoke, do you think she'd order a flamethrower?
Ask her and see.
